issue.title: VRC Gates are Kryptonite for Visual Odometry

content.raw:
This same VO algorithm was used with the PR2 to map our building - all 10 floors. We collected 40hours of data - over 2.3TB of data. 42Km. 

http://projects.csail.mit.edu/stata/

http://people.csail.mit.edu/hordurj/projects/vision-slam/

In processing that data we've seen failures of the algorithm (e.g. for blank walls) but never seen such performance as these gates give us. 

My point is not that these textures dont exist (clearly this grid could be printed on paper), but that at 3-4m range a real camera cannot capture images in which this grid is so clear and noiseless.

I don't know if thats enough to convince you, but can I ask you why these grids are important?
